BiblioData.Title: NANOWIRE ON NON- SINGLE CRYSTAL SUBSTRATE FOR OPTOELECTRONIC APPLICATIONS
BiblioData.Abstract: One embodiment in accordance with the invention is an apparatus that can include a non-single crystal substrate and a nanowire grown from a surface of the non-single crystal substrate. Furthermore, the apparatus can also include an electrode coupled to the nanowire. It is noted that the nanowire can be electrically conductive and/or optically active.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:
1. An apparatus comprising:
a non-single crystal substrate;
a nanowire grown from a surface of said non-single crystal substrate; and
an electrode coupled to said nanowire, wherein said nanowire is electrically conductive or optically active.
2. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein said nanowire is for emitting electromagnetic wave.
3. The apparatus of claim 2, wherein a display device comprises said apparatus.
4. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein said nanowire is for absorbing electromagnetic wave and generating a current.
5. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein a solar cell comprises said apparatus.
6. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein said non-single crystal substrate comprises polycrystalline silicon.
7. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein said non-single crystal substrate comprises amorphous silicon.
8. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein said non-single crystal substrate comprises microcrystalline silicon.
9. An apparatus comprising:
a non-single crystal substrate comprising:
a first protruding portion; and
a second protruding portion; and
a nanowire grown from said first protruding portion and coupled to said second protruding portion.
10. The apparatus of claim 9, wherein said nanowire is for emitting light.
11. The apparatus of claim 9, wherein said nanowire is for absorbing electromagnetic wave and generating a current.

12. The apparatus of claim 9, wherein said first protruding portion comprises a material selected from the group consisting of polycrystalline silicon, amorphous silicon, poly-crystal diamond and related carbon-based materials, and microcrystalline silicon.
13. The apparatus of claim 9, wherein said non-single crystal substrate comprises a material selected from the group consisting of glass, quartz, Mylar, steel, metal, plastic, and stainless steel.
14. The apparatus of claim 9, wherein said apparatus is incorporated with a device selected from the group consisting of a display and a solar cell.
15. A method for fabricating an apparatus, the method comprising:
disposing a nanowire above a non-single crystal substrate; and
coupling an electrode to said nanowire for conducting current.
16. The method of claim 15, wherein said nanowire is for emitting light.
17. The method of claim 15, wherein said nanowire is for absorbing electromagnetic wave and generating a current.
18. The method of claim 15, further comprising:
disposing an insulating material above said non-single crystal substrate.
19. The method of claim 15, further comprising:

disposing a material above said non-single crystal substrate, said material selected from the group consisting of polycrystalline silicon, poly-crystal diamond and related carbon-based materials, amorphous silicon, and microcrystalline silicon,
wherein said nanowire is disposed above said material.

20. The method of claim 15, wherein said nanowire comprises a material selected from the group consisting of a metal, a group III-V compound semiconductor material and related alloys, a group II-VI compound semiconductor material and related alloys, and a group IV semiconductor material and related alloys.
21. The method of claim 15, wherein said apparatus is incorporated with a device selected from the group consisting of a display, a radiation detector, and a solar cell.

22. The method of claim 15, wherein said disposing comprises disposing a plurality of nanowires above said non-single crystal substrate, wherein each of said plurality of nanowires has a random orientation.
